pricing.title: Pricing comparison
pricing.intro: Both offer generous free tiers with different pricing models—event-based vs pageview-based.

openpanel.description: Start at $2.50/month for 5,000 events. Self-host for free with unlimited events. All features included at every tier.

competitor.description: Free plan with limited features. Starter: $29/month for 5,000 pageviews. Plus: $99/month for 150,000 pageviews with A/B testing. Enterprise: $599/month for 1M pageviews.

migration.title: Migrating from Crazy Egg to OpenPanel
migration.intro: Consider if heatmaps and A/B testing are critical before switching, as these are Crazy Egg's core strengths.

items.question: What will I lose switching from Crazy Egg to OpenPanel?
items.answer: Crazy Egg's core features are heatmaps, A/B testing, on-site surveys, and popup CTAs. OpenPanel does not offer these features—it focuses on product analytics instead.

items.question: Does OpenPanel have heatmaps like Crazy Egg?
items.answer: No. OpenPanel is focused on event-based product analytics (funnels, retention, user identification) rather than visual website optimization.

items.question: How does pricing compare?
items.answer: Crazy Egg pricing starts at $29/month for 5,000 pageviews (annual billing). OpenPanel offers 10,000 events/month free, then $0.00005/event. For similar traffic, OpenPanel is typically more affordable.

items.question: Can I track mobile apps with Crazy Egg?
items.answer: No. Crazy Egg is designed exclusively for website analytics. OpenPanel offers native SDKs for iOS, Android, React Native, and Flutter.

items.question: Does OpenPanel have A/B testing like Crazy Egg?
items.answer: No. Crazy Egg includes a visual A/B testing editor as a core feature. OpenPanel focuses on analytics rather than experimentation.

items.question: Is Crazy Egg open source?
items.answer: No. Crazy Egg is proprietary closed-source. OpenPanel is fully open source under the MIT license.
